intro: Streptocarpus cyaneus subsp. cyaneus, commonly known as the blue streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers, which bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and slightly hairy. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light. This species is popular among gardeners for its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
